about_text:
The Casper Youth Hub Resource Map is a collaboration between Casper Youth Hub, youth councils around Wyoming, and the Mapping Action Collective. 
 The Resource Map centers youth needs and voices. It focuses on programs, services and leadership opportunities for youth and young adults, ages 16-25 in Wyoming, including services for health and mental healthcare, housing, education, and more. The Map began as a way to connect youth with mental health services, and has expanded to include anything that may improve quality of life for youth and young adults. 
 The Casper Youth Hub Resource Map is funded and contributed to by SAMHSA (Substance Abuse and Mental Health Service Administration) and local service providers.

contributors.name: Casper Youth Hub
contributors.description: The idea for the Casper Youth Hub Resource Map was created by youth, for youth. The Map was first proposed in Youth and Young Adult Voices Committees, which meet across Wyoming. Casper Youth Hub works with and for these youth, to support their voices and continue to develop and support the Map.

contributors.name: Mapping Action Collective
contributors.description: The Mapping Action Collective (MAC) uses mapping, data, and technology to support their community and beyond. MAC wrote the code and organized the database that powers the Casper Youth Hub Resource Map.

contributors.name: Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration (SAMHSA)
contributors.description: SAMHSA funds projects that increase access to mental health support for youth ages 16-25 in Wyoming. The Casper Youth Hub Resource Map is initially funded by SAMHSA.
